bibl.title: H.W. Hull v. Washington Territory. Case Summary.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: J.C. Nixon N.J. Black J.N. Herms

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle before Hon. RS. Greene Judge Third DT
In the matter of the application for writ of Habeas Corpus of H.W. Hull - before Hon RS Greene Judge of third district of the supreme Court of the Territory of Washington.
The Territory of Washington County of King | ss.

And now comes H.W. Hull and represents to your Honor that He is illegally restrianed of his liberty by John H McGraw the Sheriff of King County Wash Terr in the City of Seattle in said County +and Territory
div1.p:
That the cause or pretense of the restraint of his said liberty is as he the said affiant is inform and believes as follows - that at the October term of the District Court holding terms at Seattle for the County of King and Kitsap said Territory for the year 1883 He the said applicant was charge with need
and sentenced as having committed the crime of keeping a home of ill fame in said county of King. That he your said applicant give his recongizance with one JC Nixon and one Black and his and appi for his appe or and before the Supreme Court of the Territory and Terpoy and Judgement that may there be undered against him

That on the 21st day of April 1884 the said Surties surrended him your applicant to the , Sheriff of King County - and and he is by said Sheriff refuned bail - and is by him illegally deprived of his liberty.
That proves applicant is charged with a bailable offense - and that he is entitled to his liberty - bail until the final detention of said appeal in the Supreme Court
div1.ab: That he makes this application in his own behalf.
Signed in my presence and sworn to before me this 21st day of April 1884
JH Herms Notary Public Clerk of District Court of 3rd Judicial District
No 3473 District Court Seattle Wash Tery
Territory of Washington vs H.W. Hull Recognizance Copy Fees -- $1.60
Filed April 21st 1884 James Seavey Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk
